message: Hi Kaila, Beautiful photos, beautiful island. I look forward to getting back to Bali. Iâ€™m glad you are there taking care of, appreciating, and enjoying Bali. ðŸ˜Š
Hey Eric, thank, I appreciate it. Where are you from?
Hi Kaila, I hope you are having a good day!I live in Marina del Rey, CA. It is Los Angeles. Where in Bali do you live?
That sounds nice, probably far away from the homeless problem of LA. I live in kerobokan. Do you know?
I donâ€™t know kerobokan. When I get back home later today, Iâ€™ll look it up. Where in Bali is kerobokan?
Okay. Its very central, in between seminyak and denpasar. What keeps u busy today?
Near Ubud?
Today Iâ€™m at Zuma beach, north Malibu, for a memorial service ðŸ˜ª
Next Wednesday Iâ€™m off to Spain to hike the last 100 km of the Camino de Santiago. Iâ€™m walking to raise money for Los Angeles fire victims.
What did you spend your day?
How did you spend your day or weekend?
Not much, had to finish some stuff for uni projects, so I was sitting in a cafe most of the day with my friends drinking matcha and finishing up things. Do you like matcha too?
Believe it or not, Iâ€™ve never had matcha ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£
Are you still up after 2:00 am your time?
No, I've never been in the military. A friend's son died and they had a memorial service on a beach this morning. The name of the beach is Zuma beach and it's located in Malibu, California.
I was not, felt a sleep already. U should try a matcha asap then! Okay that sounds tragic. Safe travel over there and be there for your friend
I look forward to trying matcha. Sounds healthy... I hope you have an enjoyable afternoon!
Thanks Eric, hope u too. Tell me about you a bit when u have time
Hi Kaila,
I'm about to head out for our last walk before leaving for Spain. When I get back, I'll send you a note and introduce myself a little bit.
It appears that it's 10:00 pm your time, so you'll probably get my next note tomorrow morning. I hope you sleep well.
Yes you are right, I am going to bed now. I hope u enjoyed ur last walk. And I'm looking forward for your introduction note! Safe travels

Good morning Kaila. I hope you slept well and woke refreshed. I'm Eric. I've lived quite a bit, traveled a bit, worked a full career, never married, and have no kids. I have two brothers, both married, and one niece. My parents divorced many years before they died. I cared for my mother up to her death aged 90. After my mom died, I helped my father as best I could. He died two months short of his 93rd birthday. I choose things I expect will help me. I've never smoked, eat as well as I can, exercise regularly, and manage stress pretty well. Using just three words to describe who I am or what I'm about: athletic, academic, and empathetic. I'm considerably older than you.

Good morning Eric, looking fresh and fit over there! I really like what you wrote about yourself, you seem like a very caring and self-conscious person. You left open what your actual age is ðŸ˜… and how come u have never been married? Did u have any longer relationships? Hope u make it safely to Spain!
Kayla,
I leave for Spain on Wednesday. I'm on IT right now.
Tell me a little bit about you, if you don't mind.
As for my age, I'm old enough to know what I like.
Kaila, yikes Ijmis-spelled your name. Sorry about that.

I thought only women have a problem sharing their actualy age ðŸ˜ƒ so a bit about me, atm I'm still on my bachelor's degree in accounting. I have 3 younger siblings, two sisters and one brother. I still live with my parents. So during the week I'm mostly taking care of uni stuff. On the weekend I like to go to the beach with my friends. I love spicy food, I love dogs and animals in general. I also like to drive around and discover new cafÃ©s.
Nice. Your English is excellent. How many languages do you speak? How long have you known English?
What is your primary language?
I would say Indo, but I also speak Balinese. I was trying to learn some German, but German is super hard. Howal about you?

I know English pretty well. I studied French growing up, but I never got very good at it. I dabbled with Italian, but again, never got very good. I'm currently studying Spanish. I've been on Duolingo for 99 straight days. When I was in college, I traveled through Sweden. I overheard a group of Swedish students speaking perfect English and they were complaining that they could not speak English well. It was at that point, I decided the only language I speak is English. Maybe I will be able to speak Spanish and some others someday? I hope so!
Are you able to understand English without translating what or read or hear?

Hopefully u will, Spanish isn't that hard form what I have heard. Yes I would say so, sometimes I have some problems with Aussie accent or British, but American English is totally fine, that's the one I prefer
I'm impressed. When did you start learning English? How did you get so good at it?
In middle school. But I have been watching English content on youtube for a long time. You said you have been in Bali right?
Yes, in 2017. I was there for a week. Before going, I read a bit about its history. I have questions. Have you lived in Bali your whole life? In the same place or multiple places?
Living in my parents house until now ðŸ™‚
A not annoying sometimes, but it is what it is

How old are you? BTW, I'm in my late 60s! And I want you to know something: your name caught my attention. I sold a boat I rebuilt and owned for over 26 years. Her name was and is Kailani. Kailani is a Hawaiian name that metaphorically means Heavenly Water. Your name is obviously very similar. Do you know what Kaila means or was intended to mean?
Oh she's beautiful! That was a long relationship, why did you let her go? I think my name has various meanings depending from the origin.

After 26 years of putting my heart, soul, and resources into Kailani (I rebuilt, upgraded, and then maintained her in her upgraded condition), I'm focused on my new home, staying out of the office, traveling, meeting new people, and doing other things. I've been sailing since I was 14, mostly out of Marina del Rey. I'm interested in doing other things, and keeping a boat while I'm focused on other things was overwhelming for me.
Regarding your name, what does it mean to you? What does it mean to your parents?

Okay I understand, to keep a boat running comes with a lot of responsibility I guess. My name isn't directly related to our culture, I think my mom just liked that name, something a bit more western sounding. But I like Hawaiian meaning, I just looked it up: "the fashionable", suits me ðŸ™‚
The fashionable? First time I heard that attributed to Kailani! In Hawaiian, Kai means sea and land means sky. But if you like fashionable, itâ€™s your name! Itâ€™s a beautiful name.
lani means sky. Auto correct got me again. ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£
Hahah look it up!
Its late over there. I wish u sweet dreams!
Good morning Kaila.
It's now about 11:30 am here in Marina del Rey, so about 2:30 AM for you! I expect you are sound asleep right now.
And I did look it up. While Kaila is spelled very similarly to Kailani, its Hawaiian meaning is different!
Of course, you know all about it.
Yes I was. How's ur day?
My day has been good, thank you for asking!
I have some questions for you. Do you work or do you go to school, or perhaps you do both?
In currently only studying. I was doing an internship before but also for uni
How about you? What do u do for work?

Iâ€™m a California civil attorney, although Iâ€™m not practicing much any more. Iâ€™m interested in being out of the office, physically active, interacting with people, and making new friends. I also read and think about things.
What are you studying in addition to accounting? What are some of your dreams?
Iâ€™m going to go to sleep now. I hope you enjoy the rest of your day. ðŸ˜Š
Haha I guess I'm studying just life besides accounting ðŸ˜… I dream of a nice and secure family close to nature. Sweet dreams sweetheart
Studying life. That's a lifetime venture. It's a good one. Never stop learning. Never stop questioning.
What about accounting interests you? Did you choose accounting?

I'm curious. What type of educational system are you in? I've learned that educational systems in the USA are quite different than those in Europe. And I'm not familiar with educational systems in Asia or Australia. Have you been educated in Indonesia only? What is their system like? In the USA, we typically have elementary school from kindergarten through sixth grade, middle school from 7th through 9th grade, high school from 10th through 12th. Then there are various different schools from trade schools to universities, both public and private. One can graduate with an AA degree, typically a two-year program, or a BA or BS degree, an undergraduate degree from a four-year university. Then there are post graduate schools such as Medical Schools, Law Schools, Schools of Architecture, Psychology, and other areas of study. Many of those programs are within various universities. And one can earn an advanced degree in graduate schools, such as a Master or Doctoral degree in Law an LLM or JSD.

Hey! Yeah, totally agree about never stopping learning. Feels right, especially here. So accounting kinda chose me? ðŸ˜… Started with business stuff but got hooked on how numbers make sense. Like solving puzzles that actually help people. And in Bali, keeping things honest matters a lot. My school: 6 years elementary (SD), 3 years junior high (SMP), 3 years senior high (SMA). All in Indo! Now finishing my bachelorâ€™s. Your system sounds way more complicated though

It's great to hear that you value honesty. For me, it's about finding people who are dependable, reliable, and have integrity, with a charming, fit, and healthy personality to boot. Keeping things honest matters everywhere, not just Bali!
As for numbers, they donâ€™t lie. And numbers are related to music. Do you play any instruments? Are you a good singer?
Sadly I do not have talent for any thing related to music, but I like to draw and paint. How about urself?
Hi Kaila, I'm getting up with bright sunshine and you're probably getting ready to go to sleep!
Later today I will be flying to Spain. Exciting. I'm looking forward to this trip, although I keep thinking of Bali...

Regarding music, I love listening to various types of music at different times. Alas, otherwise, I am not musically inclined. I've tried learning to play instruments but it's just not in me. Or I have not yet found the pathway to that gift.
I'm excited to hear you like to draw and paint. I want to know what you like to draw and paint. Can you send me some photos of what you've done?
Have a nice trip Eric. Haha I feel u with the instruments for sure. I will share some when I have some time. Keep me updated about ur trip!

Hey Kaila, how are you in Bali. Iâ€™m sitting in an airport in Madrid. My next flight leaves in about 3 hours. This airport is crazy busy ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ Happy to be chilling. The flight from Los Angeles was 11 hours and I didnâ€™t see a single empty seat! Much more comfortable all checked in for my next flight. And itâ€™s a short one, just over an hour. Hope you are enjoying yourself.
Hey Eric, hope u finally arrived and are having a good rest. When will u start doing the walk? Over here all good, its weekend again, feels like time is flying by..

Good afternoon Kaila! Itâ€™s a beautiful morning here in Santiago. Chilly right now but should be hot later today. We leave for a 2 hour drive to Sarria later and then start walking tomorrow. After 24 hours traveling to get here with only 3 hours or so of sleeping sitting up, I feel well rested after a good nightâ€™s sleep last night. ðŸ˜Š
What are you up to this weekend?

That's awesome, I hope u have great time on your adventure! Not much, I will mostly be relaxing, maybe catch up with some friends. I hope u find peace and whatever you are looking from to get from that walk!
Just finished hiking for our 3d day. The scenery is magnificent, the air wonderfully fresh and clean, and some of the meals have been magically good! How are you?

Hey Eric, finally I hear from you! That looks so refreshing, did u jump into that inviting looking lake? I'm good, keeping myself busy over here. U look good! How are u feeling? And how much more days to go?

Hi Kaila, I hope youâ€™re day is going well so far ðŸ˜Š Today is day four and we walk into Santiago on Thursday, probably around noon. If you like an abundance of green scenery, stands of trees, walking on trails under fully covered shade of trees, fresh air, chirping birds, and those sorts of natural things, you would probably love this trek. And the hills: Up and down. Nothing to steep, but enough to feel the exertion.
I feel great! Eating great food, sleeping well. Except for the news of global crisis and so much uncertainty. The stakes are enormous for mankind. Yikes!
I fly back to Madrid on Friday and back to Los Angeles on Saturday.
Let me know if you would like some more pictures. And enjoy yourself ðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜Š

Oh wow, the way u described it sounds fabulous, I in deed wish I could walk there too, but my legs would surrender on me after a couple of miles for sure hehe. Yes I would love to see more ðŸ«¶ enjoy the rest of your trip!
Hi Kaila, some photos from today with the last after a long hike the other day! Today was a wonderful walk followed by one of the best meals Iâ€™ve ever had! What a experience ðŸ˜Š
You get tired easily? Why? You look so healthy and fit. Youâ€™re young. I hope your health is good. BTW, how old are you? Whatâ€™s your birthday?

Hahah I just dont walk that much, you seem to be used to hiking and walking longer distances. I do pilates to get some exercise. I'm 24 years old. Thank you for sharing the pictures, the natures looks so nice over there. Enjoy yourself on the last couple days of the walkðŸ¤—

Hi Kaila, I used to run track but never long distances. And I rarely walked more than 5 or 6 miles until a few months ago. Preparing for this walk, I built up over the past few months walking regularly and increasing both the distance and time. Sounds as if you can build your endurance if you want to. Pilates is a great way to stay fit!
What are your plans for today and the rest of the week? Anything preoccupying your thoughts?
FYI: Looks like weâ€™ll be walking in the rain all day today! First rainy day of this short journey ðŸ˜Š

It is also raining here too today.. gray sky and a lot of rain. I am occupied in painting, making and editing social media content and studying. Working out is a luxury but I take it. I have a Patreon of my art sketches now. I donâ€™t want to advertise to you because I am insecure about my art but if you would like to support me with your subscription, it would mean the world to me ðŸ˜Š! Just check it out. Itâ€™s art sketches that Iâ€™ve created in the last years. Maybe you will like it if you are into arts. Also, it gives some insights into my mind and psyche. I can send you the link if youâ€™d like. Only if youâ€™d like to support me of course ðŸ¥¹.
Whatâ€™s your plans for the week? What is occupying your mind lately?

Good morning sunshine, I hope you slept well and woke up smiling, looking forward to enjoying another wonderful day ðŸ˜Š I would love to explore getting to know you and building a friendship. Perhaps we can video chat sometime and confirm we are the people depicted in our respective photographs?
Let me think about it Eric, I'm super sleepy, its so late here. Talk soon ðŸ˜˜
